subject: Law
title: Qualified Immunity Controversy
description: A short lesson to help you apply Qualified Immunity Controversy.

hook.text: A police officer violated someone's rights, but the victim couldn't sue because no prior case had the exact same facts.

buildup.text: Qualified immunity protects government officials from civil lawsuits unless they violated 'clearly established' law.

discovery.text: The doctrine was created by the Supreme Court, not Congress. It has no basis in the text of any statute.

twist.text: Critics say it makes accountability nearly impossible. Supporters say officials need protection from frivolous lawsuits.

climax.text: Calls for reform grew after high-profile police misconduct cases, but the Supreme Court hasn't changed course.

punchline.text: Immunity protects good faith. The debate is where good faith ends.
